title: (Launcher Icon): When we tap on the launcher icon it will read World Baseball Classic
custom_preconds:
Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we are currently not inside of the application
custom_steps: When we tap on the World Baseball Classic launcher icon
custom_expected: Then the launcher icon will be successfully read

title: (Main Menu): Verify that all the Navigation Buttons on the Main Menu are properly read when selected
custom_preconds: Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
custom_steps: When we tap on one of the main Navigation Buttons
custom_expected:
Then the Navigation Button is properly read

REPEAT for all navigation buttons

title: (Main Menu): Verify if we have a Favorite Team set and it is visible on the main menu at the bottom that when we click it the teams name is properly read
custom_preconds:
Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we have a Favorite Team currently set
custom_steps: When we tap on our Favorite Team icon on the main menu
custom_expected: Then the button will be read as Team Name Button

title: (Scoreboard): Verify that the Audio icon is successfully read when selected
custom_preconds:
Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
custom_steps: When we tap on the Audio icon
custom_expected: Then the Audio icon is properly read

title: (Scoreboard): Verify if a game is in a Preview state and we select the vs. button that it reads as Scoreboard Matchup Button
custom_preconds:
Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we have selected the Scoreboard menu item
And there are games currently in a Preview State
And we have tapped on one of these Game Tiles
custom_steps: When we tap on the vs. button
custom_expected: Then it reads as Matchup Button

title: (News): Verify that if we tap on a News articles heading that it will properly be read
custom_preconds:
Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we have selected the News menu item
custom_steps: When we tap on a News article
custom_expected: Then the News articles heading is correctly read

custom_preconds:
Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on

And we have selected a News article
custom_steps: When we tap the News button
custom_expected: Then the button is properly read

And we have selected the Videos menu item
And we have selected the WBC.TV tab
custom_steps: When we tap on a game

Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we have selected the Videos menu item
And we have selected the Highlights tab
custom_steps: When we tap on a Highlight
custom_expected: Then the Highlight's header is properly read

Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we have selected the Settings menu item
custom_steps: When we tap on a Setting
custom_expected:
Then the Setting is properly read

REPEAT for each Setting

Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on

custom_steps: When we tap on a Team

custom_steps: When we tap on a game in the Game Schedule at the top

And we have selected the Teams menu item
And we have selected a Team
custom_steps: When we tap on a Menu Item
custom_expected:
Then the Menu Item has it's name read correctly

REPEAT for each Menu item

title: (Teams - Schedule & Results - Calendar): Verify that tapping on any day on the Calendar reads correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we tap on 'More'
And we tap on 'Teams'
And we tap on a 'Team'
And we tap on 'Schedule & Results'
And we tap on the 'Calendar' button
And we tap on each element
custom_expected:
Then each element will read correctly
And each element will be accurate

title: (Teams - Schedule  & Results - List): Verify that tapping on any game cell on the List reads correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we tap on 'More'
And we tap on 'Teams'
And we tap on a 'Team'
And we tap on 'Schedule & Results'
And we tap on the 'List' button
And we tap on each element
custom_expected:
Then each element will read correctly
And each element will be accurate

title: (Scoreboard): Verify that the Scoreboard will read in games correctly from Left to Right
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have enabled Accessibility
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to the Scoreboard
And we tap on the various games
custom_expected: Then the games will correctly be read

title: (Gameday): Verify that the Box Score in Gameday is configured for Accessibility
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have enabled Accessibility
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to Gameday
And we open up Box Score
And we tap around inside of Box Score
custom_expected: Then the Box Score will correctly read it's parts through Accessibility

title: (WBC.TV): Verify that if we are inside WBC.TV that the controls will not dismiss if the user has Accessibility enabled
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
And we have enabled Accessibility
custom_steps: When we launch an WBC.TV Stream
custom_expected: Then we will see that the Media UI Controls will no longer dismiss if the user has Accessibility enabled

title: (News): The new WorldBaseballClassic.com button the upper left needs a VoiceOver label
custom_preconds:
Given Voiceover has been activated
And the user has navigated to the News page
custom_steps: Then when the WorldBaseballClassic.com button is tapped
custom_expected: Then Voiceover will recognize it as "News Filter Button, select news for a certain team"

title: (WBC.TV): Verify that if we tap on the "Pause" button inside an WBC.TV Stream/Archive that it reads as "Pause Button"
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have launched the Application
And we have enabled "Accessibility"
custom_steps:
When we navigate to Videos
And we tap on the WBC.TV Tab
And we start up an WBC.TV Stream
Or we start up an WBC.TV Archive Stream
And we tap on the "Pause Button"
custom_expected: Then the "Pause Button" will read as "Pause Button"

title: (Launcher Icon): When we tap on the launcher icon it will read World Baseball Classic
custom_preconds:
Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we are currently not inside of the application
custom_steps: When we tap on the World Baseball Classic launcher icon
custom_expected: Then the launcher icon will be successfully read

title: (Paywall): Verify that the Paywall Carousel supports accessibility correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have enabled the Accessibility options
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we tap on the WBC.com menu
And we tap on the Buy World Baseball Classic option
And we encounter the Paywall
And we tap on the Carousel
custom_expected: Then the Carousel will successfully support Accessibility correctly

title: (Menus): Verify that the menu items in the top right corner are all readable
custom_preconds: Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
custom_steps: When we tap on a Menu item
custom_expected:
Then the menu item that was tapped will be read

Repeat for each Menu item

Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on

custom_steps: When we tap on the Date
custom_expected: Then the Date is read

Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on

And we have selected the Date in the upper left corner
custom_steps: When we navigate through the Date Picker

Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we have selected the Gameday menu item
custom_steps: When we tap on a game cell on the Out of Town scoreboard
custom_expected: Then the game cell reads as team vs. team, by score & inning & shows Gameday

title: (Gameday): When we tap on the Matchup tab then the buttons of Hide and Field are properly read

And we have selected the Gameday menu item
And the Matchup tab is open on the left side of the screen
custom_steps: When we tap the Matchup tab
custom_expected: Then the buttons of Hide & Field are read

title: (Gameday): Tapping on a Pitch in the Gameday Matchup screen allows it to be read correctly
custom_preconds:
Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on
And we have selected the Gameday menu item
And the Matchup window is visible on the left hand side
And there is a pitch inside of the Matchup window at the moment
custom_steps: When we tap on a pitch inside of the Matchup window
custom_expected:
Then the pitch is read correctly
And the pitch is read accurately

title: (Gameday): Verify that the Gameday menu buttons at the bottom can properly be read (Matchup, Box Score, Plays, Lineups & Highlights)

Given we have turned the devices Accessibility settings on

custom_steps: When we tap on a Menu Button
custom_expected:
Then the menu item selected will be read correctly

REPEAT for each Menu item

custom_steps: When we tap on the Scoreboard
custom_expected: Then the Scoreboard reads the games on it from Left to Right

Given we have installed World Baseball Classic

And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to the Scoreboard

title: (Gameday): Verify that the Box Score in Gameday is configured for Accessibility
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have enabled Accessibility

custom_steps:
When we navigate to Gameday

custom_expected: Then the Box Score will correctly read it's parts through Accessibility

title: (Team Schedules): Verify that on a Final Game popover that W reads as "Win", L reads as "Loss" and S reads as "Save"
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have enabled Accessibility
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to the Team Schedule
And we tap on a random Team to bring up it's schedule
And we tap on a finalized game to bring up it's popover
And we tap on 'W'
And we tap on 'L'
And we tap on 'S'
custom_expected:
Then 'W' will read as 'Win'
And 'L' will read as 'Loss'
And 'S' will read as 'Save'

title: (WBC.TV): Improve WBC.TV Accessibility Features
custom_preconds:
Given we have installed World Baseball Classic
And we have enabled Accessibility 
And we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
When we navigate to an WBC.TV Archived game 
And the user starts up the WBC.TV Archived game
custom_expected:
Then overlays will no longer be available the user
But the FF scrubber will remain onscreen at all times
And the Controller UI will also remain onscreen
And the overlay toggle switch will remain active only in appearance. Tapping it will perform no action

title: (Scoreboard): Pitchers on the Scoreboard that haven't pitched a major league game yet are read weirdly
custom_preconds:
Given the user has enabled Voiceover
And has navigated to the Scoreboard
custom_steps: When the user taps on a game tile in which one/both pitchers have a "-.--" ERA
custom_expected: Then Voiceover will read the ERA as "...With no ERA"

title: (Scoreboard): Tapping on a Game Cell on a game that has finished in extra innings doesn't have it mention the extra innings
custom_preconds:
Given a user has enabled Voiceover
And has navigated to the Scoreboard
custom_steps: When a game tile for a game that went into extra innings has been tapped
custom_expected: Then Voiceover will read the tile as "<Road Team> vs. <Home Team>, <Winning team> won <score> in <total innings>..."

title: Pause Button Referred to as "WBC.TV iPhone Pause, Button" on iPad When Tapped
custom_preconds: Given Voiceover has been activated
custom_steps:
When the user begins video playback of an Archive game
And taps on the Play/Pause button
custom_expected: Then Voiceover will simply recognize the button as either "Play" or "Pause"
